repnme.cdata!:
Grenada - Public Sector Modernization
            Technical Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Sector
            Modernization Technical Assistance Credit Project for
            Grenada were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: implementation of institutional reforms,
            related to the change of legal status of government
            entities, needs assessment of the constitutional and legal
            provisions, specifically if related to personnel management,
            at the design stage. Institutional changes in government
            entities aimed at improvement of service delivery require an
            assessment of legal, organizational and technical issues
            related to the business processes. Political commitment to
            project objectives is important to facilitate a legal reform
            that underlies institutional changes. The leadership and
            commitment to project development objectives on the part of
            the implementing agency is the critical factor of success.
            However, if the implementing agency shows little interest
            and is not proactive in driving project performance in areas
            not directly under its organizational purview, the
            implementation process will be challenged, even in the
            presence of an active project manager and or project
            coordinator. All project beneficiaries need to have a good
            understanding of project implementation procedures, which
            may differ from those of the government. The Bank can reach
            out to beneficiary entities by helping them understand and
            comply with project implementation procedures. The
            procurement team in coordination with the country management
            unit (CMU) reviewed the rationale for potential exceptions
            that can be applied when appropriate justification for
            inability to comply in full with the procurement rules have
            been provided by the Borrower.

repnme.cdata!:
Grenada - Public Sector Modernization
            Technical Assistance Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Sector
            Modernization Technical Assistance Project is to contribute
            to the modernization of Grenada's public sector and
            enhance service delivery. The restructuring will extend the
            closing date for the Grenada Public Sector Modernization
            Technical Assistance Credit, by nine months from the current
            closing date of June 30, 2012 until March 31, 2013. The
            original closing date of the Credit was December 31, 2010
            which was previously extended by 18 months to the current
            closing date of June 30, 2012 in October 2010. Accordingly,
            this restructuring will cumulatively extend the Credit
            closing date by 27 months from the original closing date.
            The extension through March 31, 2013 was requested by the
            Minister of Finance of the Government of Grenada in a letter
            dated April 6, 2012. The satisfactory achievement and
            sustainability of the Project Development Objective (PDO)
            will only be possible with the completion of all activities
            under component one as these will be necessary for
            modernizing the public sector that will then contribute to
            achieving efficiencies in the delivery and management of
            services with respect to registering property and starting
            businesses which are PDO-level outcome indicators.
            Completion of component one activities will require an
            extension of the current closing date of June 30, 2012. The
            extension will enable the Project to complete critical
            activities and thereby enhance the prospects for achieving
            the PDO. Accordingly, with the approval of the closing date
            extension, the team will be able to upgrade the DO rating.
            This will be the second and final extension of the Credit
            closing date.

repnme.cdata!:
Grenada - Public Sector Modernization
            Technical Assistance Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Sector
            Modernization Technical Assistance Project is to contribute
            to the modernization of Grenada's public sector and
            enhance service delivery. Following the restructuring in
            September 2010, implementation performance has improved
            albeit slowly.  Prospects for achieving the revised project
            development objective by closing date of June 2012 remains
            positive given continued Government commitment as
            demonstrated by the Cabinet approval of the framework
            document to guide the implementation of the Grenada lands
            agency. The reallocation is necessary to finance the key
            activities that will facilitate the proper functioning of
            the two enhanced departments (Corporate Affairs and
            Intellectual Property Office and Lands Agency) following
            their amalgamation under the project which are critical to
            achieving the revised project development objective.
